item.title: 斯里兰卡左翼领导人面临改变国际货币基金组织协议的严峻考验
item.description: 斯里兰卡新总统上任后的任务是为仍在遭受该国有史以来最严重经济危机残余影响的公民提供救济。现在，困难来了：让贷款人配合。【原文：Sri Lanka’s new president took office with a mandate to bring relief to citizens still burdened by the remnants of the country’s worst-ever economic crisis. Now comes the hard part: Getting the lenders to play along.】

item.title: 尽管美联储大幅减息，日元对美元汇率仍跌至 145 点
item.description: 日元贬值至 9 月初以来的最低水平，因为即使在美联储降息之后，收益率差缩小的速度仍不确定。【原文：The yen weakened to its lowest level since early September, as the pace of narrowing yield differentials remains uncertain even after the Federal Reserve cut rates.】

item.title: 寒流袭击南部，澳大利亚小麦作物再遭重创
item.description: 严重的霜冻威胁着澳大利亚南部和东南部的麦田，预计这些地区的小麦产量将占主要发货国小麦产量的 10%以上，这加剧了人们对西部地区干旱的担忧。【原文：Severe frosts have threatened fields in Australia’s south and southeast that were expected to account for more than 10% of the major shipper’s wheat production, compounding concerns over dryness in western regions.】

item.title: 了解未来不会让你赚钱
item.description:
即使交易者已经掌握了明天的消息，他们的表现仍然会很糟糕。真正重要的是他们下了多大的赌注。【原文：

Traders can still perform badly even if they already have tomorrow’s news. What really matters is how much they bet.

】

item.title: 顶级银行家通过投奔私人信贷追逐高薪
item.description:
越来越多的杠杆融资银行家跳槽到私人资本公司，以寻求更多的财富和在蓬勃发展的市场中工作的承诺。【原文：

More and more leveraged-finance bankers are jumping ship for private capital firms in the hunt for greater fortunes and the promise of working in a booming market. 

】

item.title: 贝莱德的朱厄尔称股市可应对盈利下调
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：While global corporate earnings estimates for the rest of the year appear optimistic, stock markets are likely to be able to absorb moderate downgrades for now, according to BlackRock Inc.’s Helen Jewell.】

item.title: 肯尼亚中央银行拖延导致肯尼亚债券交易所二级交易计划搁浅
item.description: 东非债券交易所（East African Bonds Exchange）称，由于在将其系统与肯尼亚中央银行的系统集成方面出现延误，其平台上的二级交易尚未开始。【原文：The East African Bonds Exchange says secondary trading on its platform is yet to commence because of delays in integrating its system to the Central Bank of Kenya’s.】

item.title: 新西兰财政部对政府债务轨迹表示担忧
item.description: 新西兰财政部的一位高级顾问说，随着人口老龄化加剧结构性预算赤字，新西兰在未来几十年将面临债务增加的问题，这对财政政策是一个重大挑战。【原文：New Zealand faces rising debt in coming decades as an aging population exacerbates a structural budget deficit, in a major challenge for fiscal policy, a top Treasury adviser said.】

item.title: 碧桂园债券持有人批准推迟支付人民币债券
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，碧桂园控股有限公司已获得债券持有人的批准，将其九元人民币债券的支付时间推迟六个月，从而使该开发商有更多的时间来制定在岸债务重组计划。【原文：Country Garden Holdings Co. has won bondholders’ approval to push back payments on its nine yuan bonds by six months, according to people familiar with the matter, giving the developer more time to map out an onshore debt overhaul.】

item.title: 基本金属走低，中国经济刺激政策疑云重重
item.description: 基本金属和铁矿石下跌，因为投资者质疑中国本周早些时候出人意料的刺激计划能否重振亚洲最大的经济体，包括房地产市场。【原文：Base metals and iron ore fell as investors questioned whether China’s surprise stimulus package earlier this week would revive Asia’s largest economy, including the real estate market.】

item.title: 新加坡娱乐公司 Neon 据说考虑明年上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，沉浸式娱乐集团 Neon 正在考虑在新加坡进行首次公开募股，募集资金可能高达 5 亿新元（约合 3.89 亿美元）。【原文：Immersive entertainment group Neon is considering an initial public offering in Singapore that may raise as much as S$500 million ($389 million), according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 印度借款计划可能推动市场反弹
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 越南称 SpaceX 的 Starlink 计划投资 150 亿美元
item.description: 越南政府援引美国太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）高级副总裁蒂姆-休斯（Tim Hughes）与越南共产党总书记杜林（To Lam）的会面内容称，该公司拟在不久的将来向越南投资 150 亿美元，用于星链（Starlink）卫星服务。【原文：SpaceX is proposing to invest $15 billion in Vietnam tied to its Starlink satellite service in the near future, the government said, citing a meeting between the company’s Senior Vice President Tim Hughes and the Communist Party’s General Secretary To Lam.】

item.title: 印度证券交易所将加强对中小企业上市的审查
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度证券交易所运营商 BSE Ltd. 已通知银行家加强对小公司首次公开募股申请的监督，因为该交易所发现最近一些交易的申报文件存在差异。【原文：Indian stock exchange operator BSE Ltd. has told bankers to increase their oversight of the initial public offering applications of small companies, after the exchange found discrepancies in the filing documents of some recent deals, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国考虑向顶级银行注资 1420 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国正在考虑向其最大的国有银行注资多达 1 万亿元人民币（1,420 亿美元），以增强其支持陷入困境的经济的能力。【原文：China is considering injecting up to 1 trillion yuan ($142 billion) of capital into its biggest state banks to increase their capacity to support the struggling economy, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构与银行合作监测人工智能的采用情况
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行（Reserve Bank）周四表示，澳大利亚金融监管机构正在与业界合作，以了解和监测人工智能的应用情况。【原文：Australia’s financial regulators are engaging with the industry to understand and monitor the adoption of artificial intelligence, the Reserve Bank said on Thursday.】

item.title: Man Group 击败中国怀疑论者，预计股价将持续上涨
item.description: 对冲基金公司 Man Group Plc 的尼克-威尔考克斯（Nick Wilcox）预计，在持续的政策支持下，中国股市将延续涨势，而不会像怀疑论者所警告的那样，涨势稍纵即逝。【原文：Nick Wilcox of hedge fund firm Man Group Plc expects Chinese stocks to extend their rally on continued policy support, defying skeptics who warn the gains will be fleeting.】

item.title: 紫金希望其非洲铜矿能与世界最大铜矿相媲美
item.description: 中国紫金矿业集团有限公司（Zijin Mining Group Co.【原文：China’s Zijin Mining Group Co. is considering an expansion of its jointly-owned copper mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo that would place it among the world’s biggest single sources of the metal.】

item.title: Netflix 的萨兰多斯担心《纸牌屋》会让他被炒鱿鱼
item.description: Netflix Inc.联席首席执行官泰德-萨兰多斯（Ted Sarandos）曾担心，他在流媒体服务公司最早的原创作品之一、政治惊悚片《纸牌屋》（House of Cards）上豪赌的 1 亿美元会断送他的职业生涯。【原文：Netflix Inc. Co-Chief Executive Officer Ted Sarandos once worried that his $100 million gamble on the political thriller House of Cards, one of the streaming service’s earliest original productions, could end his career.】

item.title: Invesco 看好日本小型股在不稳定时期的表现
item.description: Invesco 的 Yukihiro Hattori 认为，在一个不确定的世界里，日本小型股正受到青睐，而自下而上的投资风格有助于识别那些能够抵御宏观环境变化的公司。【原文：Japanese small-cap stocks are coming into favor in an uncertain world in which a bottom-up style of investing can help identify companies that are resilient to changes in macro conditions, according to Invesco’s Yukihiro Hattori.】

item.title: 新世界停牌，因有报道称首席执行官郑志刚将下台
item.description: 据彭博新闻社报道，新世界发展有限公司首席执行官郑志刚准备下台，公司股票于周四上午暂停在香港交易。【原文：New World Development Co. suspended trading of its shares in Hong Kong on Thursday morning, after Bloomberg News reported that Chief Executive Officer Adrian Cheng is poised to step down.】

item.title: 澳大利亚对冲基金的狂欢时刻--回报率傲视全球
item.description: 本周，澳大利亚一年一度的对冲基金盛会又增添了几分狂欢，其特色是海港游艇巡游和摇滚乐晚宴，基金经理们为在行业艰难时期取得的世界级回报干杯。【原文：Australia’s annual hedge fund fest, featuring a harbor yacht cruise and rock ‘n’ roll dinner, had some added revelry this week as managers toasted world-beating returns in an otherwise tough time for the industry.】

item.title: 开始生产先进人工智能芯片，SK 海力士股价大涨
item.description: SK 海力士公司（SK Hynix Inc.【原文：SK Hynix Inc. shares surged after it said it’s begun volume production of a more advanced memory chip for artificial intelligence and chipmaker Micron Technology Inc. reported strong results.】

item.title: 储能在中国绿色能源转型中占据中心位置
item.description: 在中国，储能正变得如此重要，以至于吸引了比迪斯尼乐园更多的游客。【原文：Energy storage is becoming so important in China that it’s drawing bigger crowds than Disneyland.】

item.title: 卖空者在电动汽车管道的疑虑中围攻李书福汽车公司
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商李书福（Li Auto Inc.【原文：Chinese electric-vehicle maker Li Auto Inc. has become a target for short sellers amid concerns that the company’s limited pipeline of new models this year could see it lose market share.】

item.title: 甲骨文投资芯片制造商Ampere，获得所有权选择权
item.description: 甲骨文公司表示，它拥有初创公司 Ampere Computing LLC 29% 的股份，并可以行使未来的投资期权，从而获得这家芯片制造商的控制权。【原文：Oracle Corp. said it owns 29% of startup Ampere Computing LLC and can exercise future investments options that would give it control of the chipmaker.】

item.title: 收购公司提高韩国锌业出价，公司估值达 116 亿美元
item.description: MBK Partners 将其主动提出的对韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）【原文：MBK Partners sweetened its unsolicited bid for control of Korea Zinc Co. by about 14%, pushing the stock to a record and valuing the world’s biggest zinc smelter at 15.5 trillion won ($11.6 billion).】

item.title: 新西兰央行称银行资本规则只是贷款决策的一部分
item.description: 在有人声称银行资本要求可能导致贷款机构之间缺乏竞争之后，新西兰中央银行为其在银行资本要求方面的立场进行了辩护。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank has defended its position on bank capital requirements after claims they may be contributing to a lack of competition between lenders.】

item.title: 有迹象表明利比亚可能恢复生产，石油保持大幅下跌态势
item.description: 利比亚各竞争派别就欧佩克成员国中央银行新领导层的任命达成了 "妥协"，为部分原油生产的恢复开辟了道路，石油价格在创两周最大跌幅后回稳。【原文：Oil steadied after dropping the most in two weeks as Libya’s competing factions reached a “compromise” on appointing new leadership for the OPEC member’s central bank, opening the way to the return of some crude production.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美股寻求方向。定制汽车帮助劳斯莱斯抵消了中国市场的下滑。美光大涨。中国计划派发现金。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. US stocks seek direction. Bespoke cars help Rolls-Royce offset China slump. Micron surges. China plans cash handouts. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】
